comment.body:
Wow!
Good job on this, it looks quite good @binchan2 :)

Doesn't the Stylish add-on collect user data?
I'm pretty sure that I saw a video about it some time ago, which was why I uninstalled it..

> [binchan2](#comment_11_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h): Look like it's an optional feature turned on by default for Chrome family browser: [1], it has no effect for Firefox family [2]
> 
> It's opensource on Github (only for the Firefox version I guess).But yes, I've unmaintained my themes on userstyles.org because it includes many third-party js trackers and it's now inaccessible without turning on javascript.In conclusion I'll go on using it but also alarm user for the privacy problem.Thank you for the concern :)

Just FYI, I'm using "Stylebot" now, and (at least, which doesn't mean it doesn't do the same thing as well) I haven't heard that it does anything evil like Stylish.
And in theory, the Stylish-Themes can just be copy'n'pasted to Stylebot! ;)

Also, it seems like your themes can't be used on Chrome (just yet), because the `@document`-thingy currently is only supported by Firefox. :(
